tweets.text: This weekend we are continuing to pump the firewater runoff from the major fire site in Bradford. We are monitoring this to ensure it doesn‚Äôt go into any water courses. We are working in partnership with @WYFRS @bradfordmdc @YorkshireWater https://t.co/fHrmXSUn09

We are working with @EnvAgencySW on some big plans for #Salisbury. 

Have your say about #SalisburyRiverPark during our consultation. 

More info üëâüèª https://t.co/eFkEni9DFB

#LocalGrowthFund https://t.co/9Pm3OU3AVm

#30DayMapChallenge Day 22 Movement. The retreat of the Holderness coast, data from various sources, including @EnvAgency, @OrdnanceSurvey. Lost land, villages and rates of retreat in m/y. @tjukanov #gis #qgis https://t.co/feGmpxBedx

In September SERT travelled a bit further afield than usual to achieve #FishPassage at an @EnvAgency gauging station on the River Ock, Abbingdon. 
There were numerous constraints at this site so we are piloting a Bristle Fish Pass. Read all about it here:
https://t.co/vf5Bxb6t5w https://t.co/u119h0xuFz
@EnvAgencyAnglia That is why our fund in granting research on eel. To fill the gaps in knowledge of the life cycle of this enigmatic specie. @EelGroup @EelTown_org @dupan_info

tweets.text:
We are still seeing eels at our Judas Gap pass in Essex.

This is unusual this time of year for our area as we mainly see eels migrating during the summer. 

However, they tend to reappear during high tides - which we have experienced this weeküëç #Eels #Essex https://t.co/zTODuH71K9

We are working with @WYFRS & @YorkshireWater at the Bradford fire site by removing contaminated fire-fighting water which has collected there in pools.
 
Pumps will be used to direct the water into the sewer and away from nearby becks. https://t.co/zNI1QlLU1x
Look out for crayfish traps in rivers and report any to @EnvAgency to avoid illegal deaths of wildlife such as otters reminds @thesundaytimes https://t.co/ZCNFXxbhw3

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @TroutSalmonMag @amwellmagna Arguments about mill impoundments feature in the Magna Carta. Water flow and water quality has always been an issue and always will be critical.
God this is depressing. https://t.co/ELR4ECzRWD

Our latest updates on the large fire in Bradford can be found on the link below. 

Continue to follow @bradfordmdc, @EnvAgencyYNE & @networkrail for further updates, including road closures & trains schedules. 

https://t.co/2VKfSL5rTI https://t.co/DOSmv7fodo

@PJennings88 @EnvAgency Exactly the point Jon Beer is making in latest edition of @TroutSalmonMag Izaak Walton paints an idilic picture of @amwellmagna in 1653 yet the bishops of Waltham and Westminster were arguing about who controlled the river 375 years earlier in 1278. :)

https://t.co/DeLdjjCP8J

tweets.text: So complaining about the river environment regulator is nothing new, as can be see from this letter to "The Field" 12th July 1890 from Black Gnat. Assume the Board of Conservators were a precursor to the @EnvAgency and the half-crown the equivalent of the Rod Licence. https://t.co/JnHigHFuik

Great to have part of the walk back at the waterfront now these new flood defences are in, they have done a tremendous job looking smart. They work in all weather, still plenty more to do. But so reassuring for so many. @BAMNuttall @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/Q23x8ICL2Q

tweets.text:
@Parrog3 @AffinityWater @EnvAgency @OliverHealdUK @IvelRev @AquiferChalk I'm not hydrologist, I'm always surprised when water does do what I expect, which is often. 

I know many chalk streams are ruined by over abstraction. Let's hope for a wettish winter, and that the aquifer is just being slow to release what it already has. ü§û

We are working with @EnvAgencySW on some big plans for #Salisbury. 

Have your say about #SalisburyRiverPark during our consultation. 

More info üëâüèª https://t.co/eFkEni9DFB

#LocalGrowthFund https://t.co/9Pm3OU3AVm

@Parrog3 @AffinityWater @EnvAgency @OliverHealdUK @IvelRev @AquiferChalk I have similar issues around Doncaster (not on chalk, but above an aquifer), where I have dip wells and a borehole I monitor the water table is low and flow from borehole slow. I think we just need slow consistent rain for a few weeks to percolate into water table and aquifer.
